title: PPC graph - W X Y Z points - true except

content.prompt: The diagram above shows the production possibilities curve for an economy that produces only consumption and capital goods. All of the following statements about this economy are true EXCEPT:

choices.label: Producing at point Z results in the underutilization of resources.
The combination represented by point Y is unattainable, given the scarcity of resources.
Resources are fully utilized at points W and X.
Producing at point X will result in greater economic growth than will producing at point W.
Point X represents the most efficient combination of the two goods that can be produced by this economy.

topic.text: 1.2: Opportunity Cost and the Production Possibilities Curve (PPC)

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Using economic concepts, principles, or models, explain how a specific economic outcome occurs, or what action should be taken in order to achieve a specific economic outcome.
